mdRecord.dcterms:title: Our battle-flag / Written by Edward Willet
O, never mind, boys! raise me up once again
Our battle flag
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Willett, Edward, 1830-1889
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil war song sheet in 3 verses, each followed by the refrain; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line of text: O, never mind, boys! raise me up once again.
First line of refrain: Then never mind, boys; I am ready to die.
With advertisement "500 Illustrated Ballads lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York[.] Branch office, No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C."
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include his Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.
Hand-colored headpiece of a woman holding a flag abover her head, Magnus 213A. Cf. American song sheets, 1768d.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Fourth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
